title: Tenor 2012 1:1 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (84%) makes up the majority of this wine, with the rest Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Herb, dark fruit, tobacco, carob and spice aromas are followed by ripe, tannic fruit flavors that seem to tussle at times.

title: Paul Blanck 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Gentle notes of Damask rose and honeysuckle shimmer teasingly above a balanced, just off-dry palate that features orange peel, juicy yellow peach and nectarine. This wine offers a charming but not overpowering and nicely balanced rendition of this grape.

title: Januik 2013 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)
description: The aromas bring notes of plum, dark chocolate, clove and barrel spice. The flavors are forward and lush, showing irresistible appeal.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Domaine des Hospices de Belleville  (Brouilly)
description: The charity Hospices of Belleville owns the land as part of its foundation, with the wines being made by Beaune negociant Joseph Drouhin. This wine is attractively fruity and soft. With its red-cherry and lightly spiced flavors, which are cut with acidity, it has a fine balanced texture, finishing with bright red-fruit acidity. Drink now.

title: Keller Estate 2014 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with full-bodied, rich aromas of caramel-laced apple pie before taking on fresh lightness on the palate defined by floral apple blossom, guava and mango, the midpalate maintaining crisp acidity. The finish is lengthy in butterscotch.

title: Leyda 2013 Lot 21 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Full roasted-plum aromas outweigh any nuance the nose might hold, while this is medium to full in body, with enough viscosity. Flavors of spicy cherry and plum are barrel-driven, with notes of clove and cinnamon backing the wine's fruit. A finish based on toasty oak serves this well.

title: Leyda 2013 Lot 8 Syrah (Leyda Valley)
description: Earthy, gritty berry aromas are a touch horsey. This coastal Syrah feels tight and concentrated, with rugged tannins. Peppery toasty plum and wild-herb flavors finish spicy and drying, with some back-end heat.

title: Vins El Cep 2010 Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)
description: Yeasty, bready aromas of toast and apple set up a smooth, mature palate with good acidity. Apple, quince and dry yeasty, toasty flavors end with length, complexity and a mild note of baked apple. Drink now.
designation: Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature

title: Merriman 2013 The Brasher Block Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of freshly cut yellow apple, herb and beeswax lead to a medium-bodied palate. It shows good intensity and length.

title: Michaud 2015 Marsanne (Chalone)
description: Clean and light aromas of apples, sharp nectarine, yellow lilies and crushed white rocks make for a compelling nose on this bottling. The palate is very high-toned on first sip, then opens up with flavors of seared lemon rinds, saffron, sea salt and a light custard.

title: Frédéric Mallo 2013 Cuvée Saint Jacques Riesling (Alsace)
description: Notes of herb and stone color the subdued fruit of the nose on this wine. The medium-sweet palate reveals a more honeyed nature, hemmed in by a pithy, almost earthy bitterness of citrus peel, giving both balance and texture. The long finish is concentrated.

title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2015 La Roche  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: The Tête family is well known in Beaujolais both as vineyard owners and as wine merchants. This wine comes from a family-owned vineyard close to Juliénas. It is fruity and ripe with a rich texture and warm tannins. Perfumed and with fine acidity, it is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2015 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: From vines at La Sambinerie in Romanèche-Thorins, this ripe fruity wine is rich and full-bodied. It has spice, light tannins and juicy black-cherry fruits. With acidity and structure at the end, it is a fine wine, ready to drink.

title: Florent Descombe 2015  Juliénas
description: The wine is dense with both tannins and black cherry fruit. It has structure, some fine concentration and plenty of acidity to sustain the rich fruits. It is a rich wine and could age further, so drink from 2017.

title: Hugel 2014 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Hints of rosewater and Turkish Delight waft from the glass. More toned down, the palate shines with citric freshness. There is quite a bit of warmth that seems to intensify the floral peach notes even more. It's very aromatic and varietally true, with a tropical finish of passion fruit.

title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Stemmy on the nose, this is a juicy, almost carbonic wine, spritzy in acidity and appealing in its bright, refreshing take on the variety, a buoyantly light mix of raspberry, cherry and cedar.

title: North by Northwest 2013 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, herb and dark fruit lead to tart, full cranberry and cherry flavors. Coffee notes linger on the finish and the tannins provide a gentle grip.

title: River Road 2014 Stephanie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Earthy forest floor and Asian spice ride atop layers of tangy orange and cherry in this wine defined by lively acidity and a juicy core. Medium bodied in weight and breadth, it finishes in chocolate and vanilla, the oak subtle and supportive.

title: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Superripe pear notes on the nose lead to a more slender, defined palate of green Conference pear flavors and lovely midpalate texture. This wine has freshness and a juicy, appetizing honesty, with an intriguing bitter-almond finish that is totally moreish.

title: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)
description: Boisterously fruity and aromatic, this full-bodied white offers a bounty of luscious peach, pineapple and mango flavors. It's voluptuously ripe yet briskly balanced, finishing on a crisp mineral tone. Drink now through 2018 to capture the essence of its fresh, fruity style.

title: Peju 2015 Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: This proprietary blend of Zinfandel, Syrah and Malbec satisfies, offering a crisp, creamy layering of strawberry and grapefruit atop a medium-sized body and salty, tangy finish.

title: Quivira 2014 Flight Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from Biodynamic-certified grapes, this opens in tangy cranberry and orange, a refreshingly bright lift for the variety. Full bodied, it teases in leather, pepper and a touch of smoky oak, remaining in balance as it plays out on the palate.

title: René Muré 2014 Cote de Rouffach Riesling (Alsace)
description: A closed nose opens into the taut but streamlined body of this wine. There is tension on the slender but concentrated palate and a fearlessly brisk freshness, leading to a dry finish. The wine will benefit from bottle age and reward patience with glorious apple fruit. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Maison Bleue 2013 Metis Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 45% Grenache, 37% Syrah and 18% Mourvèdre, coming from Boushey, Pepper Bridge, Olsen and Minnick vineyards. The aromas pop with notes of clove, orange peel, black pepper, funk and red and blue berries. The palate is lithe, pure and focused, with a pleasing mouthfeel and sense of balance to the citrus and blue-fruit flavors.

title: Martin Ray 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Apple blossom intrigues on the nose of this light-bodied, low-oaked white. It's both steely and revealing, showing succulent mango, peach and pear. The acidity is lively and balanced.

title: Martinsancho 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This Verdejo smells like citrus fruits and wild field grass, with a hint of feline aroma. Crisp and fresh, it offers flavors of melon, nectarine and nettle. A long, slightly salty finish is braced by bright acidity. Drink right away, if possible.

title: Navarro 2014 Estate Bottled Dry Muscat Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: A dry Muscat (or Moscato) is a rare find, and this is a beauty. Very floral and spicy in aroma, it has classic flavors like peaches and lychee. It is not sweet but buoyed by good acidity, great balance and a lingering, crisp and appley finish.

title: Nemeion Estate 2008 Reserve Agiorgitiko (Nemea)
description: In a word: stately. The wine starts with cedar, leather and olive aromas, followed by complex flavors of cinnamon, red fruit and a touch of spicy smoke. This wine will age well but is delicious now.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cocoa powder, vanilla, toast and high-toned blue and black-fruit flavors are followed by a flavorful fruit-forward palate. It doesn't always seem entirely varietal but still brings plenty of appeal.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Cascadia Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is the inaugural release of this wine, which is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. It brings aromas of espresso, toast, bittersweet chocolate, vanilla and dark berries. The fruit and barrel flavors are soft and sumptuous, playing off each other nicely through the finish.
